We may say at once that the volume is most interesting and should prove of great value to the future South-African hiatory in dealing with the many stirring events which have taken place during the period it covers. Enough has already been given to show that the whole book is full of inte
rest and worthy the study of all, who wish to know the ins and outs of the intricate Transvaal questions. (South Afriean Review). RAS-VEREESieiNG.

To all who are interested in the inner history of South-African questions, this little volume should prove exceedingly welcome. This testimony is of value, and we believe it to be bot accurate and sincere. It seems a pity that a book containing so much that is of interest to Engl hmen, should not be published in English (Manchester Guardian}. Orthopaedi-Bandages.
